context_bundle.summary: Next.js 14+ App Router patterns with React Server Components, server actions, streaming, caching strategies, and full-stack React application development

onboarding.quick_start: npx create-next-app@latest my-app --typescript --app --tailwind && cd my-app && npm run dev
common_patterns:
Server component: 'export default async function Page() { const data = await fetch("https://api.example.com/data"); return
{data.title}
; }' in app/ directory

Client component: '"use client"; import { useState } from "react"; export default function Counter() { const [count, setCount] = useState(0); return <button onClick={() => setCount(count + 1)}>{count}</button>; }'
Server actions: '"use server"; export async function createUser(formData: FormData) { const name = formData.get("name"); await db.users.create({ name }); revalidatePath("/users"); }'
Dynamic routes: 'app/posts/[id]/page.tsx with params: { id: string }' for dynamic segments
Loading UI: 'app/posts/loading.tsx exports default function Loading() { return <Skeleton />; }' for instant loading states
Error handling: 'app/posts/error.tsx with "use client" and error boundary props'
Metadata API: 'export const metadata: Metadata = { title: "My Page", description: "Page description" };'
Route handlers: 'app/api/users/route.ts with export async function GET(request: Request) { return Response.json({ users }); }'
known_errors: Hydration mismatch: Ensure server and client render same HTML, avoid Date.now() or random values
useState in server component: Move to client component with '"use client"' directive
Fetch not cached: Use 'fetch(url, { cache: "force-cache" })' or 'next: { revalidate: 3600 }'
Dynamic rendering: Check for cookies(), headers(), or searchParams usage forcing dynamic rendering
Module not found: Check import paths, use '@/' alias configured in tsconfig.json
Server action not working: Add '"use server"' directive, ensure form action or startTransition usage
